recipes.title: Easy Guacamole
recipes.description: Simple and delicious guacamole.

instructions.text: Place avocados in bowl and sprinkle with lime juice, salt, and pepper; mash with fork until desired texture.
Stir remaining ingredients into avocados. Chill 30 minutes for flavors to blend or until ready to serve.

notes: Other preparation methods: Bake - Preheat oven to 400°F. Cut 1 ripe, peeled avocado into 8 wedges; place in baking dish. Coat with 1 tablespoon each: salt, oil and 1/4 teaspoon each: salt, pepper, and red pepper. Bake 20-25 minutes or until edges are golden. Sprinkle with 1 teaspoon fresh lime juice. Sauce: Place 2 ripe, peeled avocados into food processor bowl; add 1 tablespoon fresh lime juice, 1 1/2 cups fresh cilantro, 1/4 cup sour cream, and 1/2 teaspoon total seasoning. Process until smooth. Serve over chicken, beef, or pork.

recipes.title: Sausage-Stuffed Mushrooms
recipes.description: Large mushroom caps stuffed with seasoned pork sausage.

instructions.text: In a medium bowl, place sausage.
Remove stems from mushrooms. Finely chop stems. Mix with sausage. Place mushroom caps on baking pan with top-sides down.
Divide sausage mixture into 16 portions. Shape into balls. Place one ball into each mushroom cap.
Sprinkle tops lightly with salt and pepper.
Bake at 400°F for 15 to 20 minutes until sausage is browned and cooked through.
Garnish with parsley. Serve immediately.

notes: Good served with: Herbed rice pilaf and a tossed salad to make a light supper.
Tips: To clean mushrooms, gently rinse in cold water and pat dry.
Variations: You may substitute bulk Italian or Polish sausage for the breakfast-style sausage. For variety, serve mushrooms on buttered toast or tomato slices.

recipes.title: Pizza Horns

instructions.text: To thaw dough, refrigerate overnight or let stand at room temperature for 2 to 3 hours.
On a lightly floured surface, roll each loaf into a 10-inch circle or pat and stretch with hands until 1/4-inch thick. Brush surface with oil.
With a pizza cutter or sharp knife, cut each circle into 8 triangular wedges.
Combine sauce, oregano and garlic powder. Spread on top of wedges, leaving about 1/4-inch margin on each side.
Sprinkle with cheeses, green pepper and pepperoni. Roll up, each triangle beginning from wide end. Curve ends to form crescents.
Place on lightly oiled baking sheets. Brush tops with egg white. Sprinkle with additional oregano and/or Parmesan cheese.
Bake at 450°F for 15 minutes or until golden brown.

notes: Health Note: Using frozen wheat bread dough adds extra nutrition to this recipe. Tips: You may vary the filling according to taste. Try toppings such as mushrooms or onions.

assumptions: frozen bread dough: used default unit
pizza oregano leaves: used default unit
lightly beaten oregano: used default unit

recipes.title: Garlic Bean Dip
recipes.description: Creamy white bean dip with garlic and cumin.

ingredients.item: Hellmann's or Best Foods Real or Low Fat Mayonnaise or Dressing

instructions.text: In food processor combine first 5 ingredients. Process 1 minute, scraping bowl once, or until almost smooth.
Blend in mayonnaise and parsley.
Serve with Pita Crisps (see recipe on next page), melba toasts or cut-up vegetables.

assumptions: Hellmann's or Best Foods Real or Low Fat Mayonnaise or Dressing: used default unit

ingredients.item: nonfat plain yogurt or sour cream
PUBLIX Fat Free Cream Cheese, softened
fat free shredded cheddar cheese, flaked

instructions.text: Combine yogurt, mayonnaise, cream cheese and seasonings.
Mix well. Stir in shredded cheese and crab. Cover and chill 2 hours.
Sprinkle with paprika. Serve with crackers, breadsticks or vegetables.

assumptions: PUBLIX Fat Free Cream Cheese, softened: used default unit
fat free mayonnaise: used default unit

recipes.title: Homemade Ice Cream Sodas
recipes.description: Five classic ice cream soda variations including black and white, coffee, lemon, and fruity.

instructions.text: Black and White Ice Cream Soda: In tall glass, pour milk. Top with syrup and a scoop of ice cream. Fill with soda water. Garnish with chocolate curls.
Coffee Ice Cream Soda: In tall glass, pour milk. Add syrup and a scoop of ice cream. Fill with soda water.
Lemon Ice Cream Soda: In tall glass, pour milk and lemonade. Add a scoop of ice cream. Fill with soda water.
Fruity Ice Cream Soda: In tall glass, place fruit puree, milk and a scoop of ice cream. Fill with soda water.

Coffee Syrup: In sauce pan, mix 1 cup granulated sugar, 1 cup light corn syrup and 1 1/2 cups water. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Remove from heat. Stir in 1/4 cup instant coffee and 1 teaspoon vanilla extract. Keep refrigerated.

assumptions: vanilla ice cream: used default unit
chilled soda water: used default unit
Coffee Syrup (see below): used default unit
frozen lemonade concentrate: used default unit
raspberries or peaches: used default unit
light corn syrup: used default unit

recipes.title: Health Tonic (Apple Cider Vinegar Mix)

instructions.text: Combine all ingredients in a glass jar with a tight-fitting lid.
Shake well before each use.
Take 1-2 tablespoons daily, diluted in water or juice if desired.
Store in refrigerator.

notes: Apple cider vinegar health tonic - traditional remedy.

assumptions: wheat germ oil: used default unit

recipes.title: Marky's Blue-Eyed Muffins
recipes.description: Blueberry muffins with a cinnamon crumble topping.

instructions.text: In a large bowl, cream together butter and sugars until light. Beat in egg.
In a medium bowl, combine flour, baking powder and salt. Alternately with milk, add to creamed mixture. Do not over-mix.
Fold in blueberries. Spoon mixture into greased muffin pans.
To prepare topping, combine sugar, flour and cinnamon. Cut in butter.
Sprinkle topping evenly over muffin batter.
Bake at 400°F for 20 minutes. Cool for 1 minute. Remove from pans.

notes: Good served with fresh pineapple and hot coffee or tea.

recipes.title: Grandma's Wheat Berrie Muffins
recipes.description: Healthy muffins with wheat flour, blueberries and sunflower seeds.

instructions.text: Mix together: eggs, sugar, butter/margarine, extract.
Add to egg mix: flour, baking powder, salt. Add to another bowl, mix flour, baking powder, and salt. Stir in blueberries.
Stir in sunflower seeds.
Fill muffin cups 3/4 full.
Bake at 350 degrees for 20-25 minutes.

recipes.title: Spiced Blueberry Jam
recipes.description: Homemade blueberry jam with warm spices.

ingredients.prep_note: or 1 pkg (1 lb) frozen blueberries, thawed

instructions.text: Remove any stems from berries. Crush fruit, 1/2 cup at a time. Measure 2-1/4 cups, packed solidly. If necessary, add water to make up amount. Pour into very large saucepan or Dutch oven.
Add lemon juice, sugar and spices. Mix well. Bring to a rolling boil (a boil that can't be stirred down). Boil 1 minute. Remove from heat. Immediately stir in pectin.
Ladle into hot jelly glasses or jars. Pour 1/8-inch hot paraffin over top. Paraffin should cling to sides of jars and contain no air bubbles.
Cover with lids. Store in cool, dry place.

notes: Tips: If using fresh blueberries, carefully rinse under cold running water, drain and plump berries.

recipes.title: Maple Pecan Waffles

instructions.text: In bowl, sift together flour, baking powder and salt.
In mixing bowl, beat together egg yolks, milk and oil until combined. Gradually add flour mixture, beating after each addition. Beat only until smooth.
In small bowl, beat egg whites until stiff peaks form. Fold whites into batter. Stir in pecans and maple extract.
For each waffle, pour up to 3/4 cup batter into center of waffle iron until it spreads to 1 inch from edges.
Cook until waffle iron stops steaming. Waffle should be crisp and golden. Serve immediately.
Garnish with sliced strawberries. Serve with warmed maple syrup and melted butter.

notes: Any leftover waffles can be frozen. Wrap tightly in plastic wrap or seal in a plastic bag and freeze. Reheat frozen waffles in toaster.

recipes.title: Quiche Crepes
recipes.description: Individual quiches baked in delicate crepes with bacon and Swiss cheese.

ingredients.prep_note: each salt, white pepper and nutmeg

instructions.text: CREPE BATTER: Beat 2 eggs with 3/4 cup each milk and water. Blend in 3/4 cup flour and 1/4 tsp salt. Stir in 2 tbsp melted butter.
Make crepes in a small skillet. Set aside.
FILLING: Cook bacon until crisp; crumble. Reserve.
Line 1-cup souffle dishes with crepes, allowing edges to extend over rim.
Divide bacon, cheese, and onion among crepe-lined dishes.
Beat 3 eggs with cream, milk, salt, pepper, and nutmeg. Pour into dishes.
Bake at 375°F for 25-30 minutes until puffed and browned.

notes: [RECONSTRUCTED: Original instructions were garbled - rewritten for clarity]
Crepes can be served from dish. To remove, loosen with knife tip.

flags: Step 5 references "broccoli dish" not in recipe
Ingredient list mixes crepe batter with filling without clear separation
Original source may have had OCR errors or page ordering issues

assumptions: finely minced onion: used default unit

recipes.title: Fabulous French Toast

instructions.text: Arrange bread in single layer in a shallow baking pan.

In medium bowl, beat eggs. Beat in sugar, cream, milk, vanilla and salt. Pour egg mixture over bread slices evenly on both sides. Set aside for 10 minutes (or cover and refrigerate overnight) to allow bread to absorb all liquid.
Heat butter in large skillet (or griddle) over medium heat. When butter sizzles, add bread slices. Do not crowd pan. Cook slowly so bread exterior doesn't burn before inside is cooked, 5-10 minutes.
Turn over to cook other side. When underside is golden brown, transfer to plates.
Sift confectioners sugar over toast. Serve with hot syrup or sliced and sugared berries.

notes: Crispy on the outside, creamy on the inside. To prepare this breakfast treat ahead, just cover and refrigerate overnight - all set to cook in the morning.
Recipe can be doubled or tripled. Keep cooked toast warm in 250-degree oven.

assumptions: PUBLIX White Mountain Bread: used default unit
PUBLIX Whipping Cream: used default unit
PUBLIX Sweet Cream Butter: used default unit

instructions.text: Combine 1 cup NORA Mill Plain Cornmeal, 1/4 cup flour, 1/2 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp baking soda.
Add 1/2 cup instant nonfat dry milk, 1/2 C water and 2 tsp baking powder to batter. Fry on a nonstick or lightly greased griddle.
Omit baking soda and salt if using Self-Rising Cornmeal.
Combine 1 cup NORA Mill Plain Cornmeal, 1 Tbs honey and 1 cup boiling water. Cool slightly.
Add 1 Tbs oil. Combine these two mixtures. Add 1/2 cup instant nonfat dry milk, 1/2 cup water and 2 tsp baking powder to batter.
Fry on a nonstick or lightly greased griddle.
Omit baking powder if using Self-Rising Cornmeal.

recipes.title: Easy Croissants
recipes.description: Buttery, flaky croissants with optional chocolate, apple-almond, or other fillings.

instructions.text: In bowl, dissolve yeast in water. Add milk, salt, eggs and 1 cup flour. Beat until smooth. Blend in melted butter.
In large bowl with food processor, place remaining flour. Cut in butter slices until butter is size of kidney beans.
Pour yeast mixture. Blend just until flour is moistened. Cover. Chill 2 to 48 hours.
Cut dough into quarters. Dust one quarter at a time. Roll into a circle 16-inches in diameter. Cut into 8 wedges. Repeat with remaining dough.
Place filling, if used, on wide ends. Roll up each toward point. Shape into crescents. Place on ungreased baking sheet. Let rise 2 hours. Brush with egg.
Bake at 375°F 10 to 15 minutes until golden.

notes: Chocolate filling: Place 2 tablespoons of chocolate chips on wide end of wedge. Apple-Almond filling: Combine 1/2 cup almond paste and 3/4 cup applesauce. Spoon 2 tablespoons on wide end of wedge.

assumptions: active dry yeast: used default unit

recipes.title: Bubble Loaf
recipes.description: Pull-apart bread with herbs and cheese.

instructions.text: Cut thawed dough into small pieces.
Dip each piece in melted butter.
Mix cheese with parsley and garlic powder.
Roll buttered pieces in cheese mixture.
Layer pieces in greased loaf pan.
Let rise until doubled, about 1 hour.
Bake at 375°F for about 30 minutes until golden.

recipes.title: Irish Soda Bread
recipes.source_note: Landmark Tavern, Ltd. - 626 Eleventh Avenue, New York, N.Y. 10036
recipes.description: Traditional Irish soda bread from the famous Landmark Tavern in NYC.

instructions.text: Sift together flour, nutmeg, cinnamon, baking soda (and baking powder if used).
Beat together eggs and sugar until blended.
When blended add buttermilk, mix until blended, then add to dry ingredients until it forms dough.
Add drained raisins and mix into dough.
Bake at 350° for 25 to 30 minutes.
Serve warm.

notes: This is a COMMERCIAL/RESTAURANT batch recipe making 8-10 loaves.
FOR HOME USE (1 loaf): 2 cups flour, 1/2 tsp nutmeg, 1/2 tsp baking soda, 1/4 cup sugar, 1/2 cup raisins, 3/4 cup buttermilk, 1 egg. Bake 25-30 min at 350°F.
Good luck and thank you for your interest.

flags: COMMERCIAL BATCH: Makes 8-10 loaves - see notes for home-scale version

recipes.title: Banana Bread
recipes.attribution: Recipe from the kitchen of Dewolf
recipes.description: Moist banana bread - a family favorite.

instructions.text: Melt shortening in a glass measuring cup in microwave oven (1 min. at Normal). Cool.
Sift flour, baking powder, salt and sugar together in a bowl.
Beat eggs and mashed bananas until blended. Add cooled shortening, mix well.
Mix flour and egg-banana mixture together, stirring until just combined.
Pour into greased loaf pan.
Bake at 350° for 25 to 30 minutes or until done.

recipes.title: Danish Kringle and Pastry Horns
recipes.source_note: My Great Recipes card - Your Bountiful Home Bakery Card 47
recipes.description: Traditional Danish pastries with almond filling.

instructions.text: In large bowl, combine sugar, yeast, salt and 2 cups flour.
Beat 2 minutes. Add eggs, flavoring. Gradually add enough flour to make a stiff dough. Stir until just mixed.
On floured surface, knead dough until smooth and elastic. Place in a greased bowl. Turn to grease top. Cover. Let rise in warm place, about 1 hour.

Turn dough out. Divide into 4 pieces. Roll each into 10-by-11-inch circles. Cut into 8 wedges. Place jam at wide ends. Roll. Place seam-side down on greased baking sheet. Bake at 375°F for 15 minutes until golden. Sprinkle with powdered sugar.

notes: For Kringle filling: Combine pastry paste, butter and cup granulated sugar. Add egg. Mix well.

assumptions: apricot or raspberry jam: used default unit

recipes.title: Cranberry Upside-Down Muffins
recipes.description: Tender muffins with a caramelized cranberry topping.

instructions.text: Divide cranberries evenly between 12 greased 3-inch muffin pans. Spoon about 1 teaspoon butter into each. Sprinkle evenly with brown sugar.
In a mixing bowl, stir together flour, baking powder, sugar, salt and raisins.
In a small bowl, beat egg. Mix in milk and remaining melted butter. Add to flour mixture. Stir until dry ingredients are just moistened.
Evenly divide batter between cranberries in muffin pans.
Bake at 400°F for 30 minutes or until golden brown. Let muffins stand on wire rack until bubbling stops.
Turn out carefully onto serving plate. Serve upside-down.

notes: These muffins freeze very well. Reheat (without thawing) at 350°F for about 30 minutes
Variations: Try this recipe using blueberries or raspberries
Good served with fluffy scrambled eggs and well browned sausage links

recipes.title: Peach'n Berry Twists
recipes.description: Sweet breakfast pastries with peach filling.

ingredients.item: warm Pillsbury's Best All Purpose Flour

instructions.text: Spoon into cup and level off; stir together flour and salt and 2 cups flour. Cover; let rise in warm place until light, 45 to 60 minutes.
To make the filling, combine reserved peach syrup with 1/4 cup of each, split, roll into 1 piece, fold in thirds, seal edges, stretch 10 to 11 inches long.
Twist each strip; form into circle and tuck under. Place on lightly greased baking sheet. Brush with egg. Let rise about 15 minutes.
Bake at 375°F for 12 to 15 minutes until golden brown. Sprinkle with powdered sugar.

notes: HIGH ALTITUDE ADJUSTMENT - 5200 feet: Not necessary

assumptions: active dry yeast: used default unit

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour loaf pans.
In a large bowl, mix together dry ingredients. Add wet ingredients and mix until combined.
Divide batter in 3 pans. Bake in 350° preheated oven until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.
Cool before slicing. Wrap in foil. Store in refrigerator.
Stir together 1-1/2 cups NORA Mill Plain Cornmeal, 1/2 tsp baking soda, salt, and 1 C buttermilk.
Add liquid ingredients. Sack in hot greased skillet or muffin pans at 400°F, oven for 25-30 minutes.
When baking soda, salt and baking powder to using Self-Rising Cornmeal.

recipes.title: Southern Cornbread

instructions.text: Stir together 1-1/2 cups NORA Mill Plain Cornmeal, 1/2 tsp baking soda, and 1 tsp salt.
Mix dry ingredients and combine 1 cup buttermilk, 1/4 C vegetable oil, and 1 egg. Mix dry and liquid ingredients.
Place in hot, preheated skillet. Bake in 450°F oven while you prepare the cornbread.
If using Self-Rising Cornmeal, omit baking soda and salt.

notes: Evenly spread mixture or continue for skillet or muffin cups.

assumptions: NORA Mill Plain Cornmeal: used default unit

instructions.text: If using Self-Rising Cornmeal mix add 1-1/4 cups milk, omit baking soda and salt.
Mix all ingredients. Bake in well-greased iron skillet or muffin tins at 400°F oven for 20-25 minutes.
Bake for 12 minutes, Makes 12 muffins or sticks.

assumptions: Self-Rising Cornmeal mix: used default unit

recipes.title: Grandma's Biscuits
recipes.source_note: Grandma's Biscuit & Pancake Mix recipe card

instructions.text: COMBINE 2 Cups mix with 1/2 Cup water. MIX with fork until blended.
TURN OUT on floured board and knead 5 times. ROLL to desired thickness and cut with floured cutter.
BAKE on a shiny cookie sheet in a preheated 450°F oven for 12 minutes.
For perfect biscuits, use a sharp cutter, cut with a straight up and down motion, and place in baking pan close together.

assumptions: Grandma's Biscuit & Pancake Mix: used default unit

recipes.title: Tender Drop Biscuits
recipes.source_note: Grandma's Biscuit & Pancake Mix recipe card

instructions.text: COMBINE 1-1/2 Cups mix with 1/2 Cup water.
STIR until blended. DROP by spoonfuls onto a shiny cookie sheet.
BAKE in a preheated 450°F oven for 10 minutes.

assumptions: Grandma's Biscuit & Pancake Mix: used default unit

recipes.title: Sweet Muffins
recipes.source_note: Grandma's Biscuit & Pancake Mix recipe card
notes: HINT: You can add blueberries, raisins, jelly, cinnamon, etc.

instructions.text: COMBINE 1 egg with 1/2 Cup water and blend well.
POUR into 1-1/2 Cup mix, add 2 Tbs. sugar and stir only until moistened.
SPOON into well greased or paper lined muffin tins.
BAKE in a preheated 450°F oven for 10 minutes.
HINT: You can add blueberries, raisins, jelly, cinnamon, etc. to this basic recipe.

assumptions: Grandma's Biscuit & Pancake Mix: used default unit

recipes.title: Lemon Poppy Seed Muffins
recipes.source_note: Grandma's Biscuit & Pancake Mix recipe card

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.
Combine dry ingredients. Mix liquid ingredients well. Add to dry ingredients. Stir just until blended.
Bake in greased muffin tins for 15 minutes or until done.

assumptions: Grandma's Biscuit & Pancake Mix: used default unit
grated lemon peel: used default unit
Nora Mill Poppy Seeds: used default unit

recipes.title: Garlic Cheese Drop Biscuits (like Red Lobster's)
recipes.source_note: Grandma's Biscuit & Pancake Mix recipe card
notes: These are yummy - just like Red Lobster's!

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 450°F.
Combine Grandma's Biscuit & Pancake Mix, milk and cheddar cheese, and mix well.
Drop dough by heaping tablespoonfuls onto an ungreased cookie sheet.
Bake 8-10 minutes or until golden brown.
Combine butter, Italian seasoning and garlic powder. Brush over warm biscuits before removing them from cookie sheet. Serve warm.
Wonderful with soups, stews and pasta dishes.

assumptions: Grandma's Biscuit & Pancake Mix: used default unit

recipes.title: Broccoli Cornbread (Handwritten)
notes: Option: Hot Peppers

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°F. Grease a 9x13 inch baking pan.
Mix all ingredients together until well combined.
Pour into prepared pan.
Bake for 25-30 minutes or until golden brown and set.

assumptions: broccoli, thawed and drained: used default unit

instructions.text: Combine bran cereal and milk; let stand 5 minutes.
Add egg and oil; beat well.
Combine flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
Add to bran mixture; stir just until moistened.
Fill greased muffin cups 2/3 full.
Bake at 400°F for 20-25 minutes.

recipes.title: Banana Bread (Handwritten with Stove Drawing)
recipes.source_note: Handwritten card with hand-drawn vintage stove from kitchen of Dewolf

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease a loaf pan.
Mix mashed bananas, sugar, egg, and melted butter.
Add flour, baking soda, salt, and vanilla. Mix until just combined.
Pour into prepared pan.
Bake 55-60 minutes or until toothpick comes out clean.

notes: Recipe card has beautiful stove illustration, from kitchen of Dewolf

recipes.title: Irish Soda Bread (Landmark Tavern, NYC)
recipes.source_note: typed recipe from Landmark Tavern, Ltd., New York, N.Y.

instructions.text: Sift together the flour, nutmeg, cinnamon, baking powder and sugar.
Beat the eggs and add until blended, then add to above into dough.
Mix well.
Bake at 325°F for 25 to 30 minutes.
Serve warm.

notes: Historic recipe from Landmark Tavern, New York City
Good luck and thank you for your interest.

recipes.title: "No Regrets" Cheesecake
recipes.description: A creamy cheesecake from Publix.

instructions.text: Beat cream cheese until smooth.
Add sugar and beat until fluffy.
Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each.
Stir in vanilla.
Pour into graham cracker crust.
Bake at 350°F for 40 minutes.
Cool and refrigerate before serving.

assumptions: graham cracker crust: used default unit

recipes.title: Quaker's Best Oatmeal Cookies
recipes.description: Classic oatmeal cookies from the Quaker Oats recipe.

instructions.text: Heat oven to 350°F.
Beat butter and sugars until creamy.
Add eggs and vanilla; beat well.
Add combined flour, baking soda, cinnamon and salt; mix well.
Stir in oats; mix well.
Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheet.
Bake 8 to 9 minutes for a chewy cookie or 10 to 11 minutes for a crisp cookie.
Cool 1 minute on cookie sheet; remove to wire rack.

notes: Add 1 cup raisins, chocolate chips, or chopped nuts if desired.

recipes.title: Buttercups
recipes.description: Individual pie crust cups filled with a sweet coconut filling.

instructions.text: Mix sugar and margarine. Cream. Add rest of ingredients. Mix well.
For ready made pie crust, roll the crust out like you would a pie using 7 by 11 pan. Put crust in bottom, then spread filling over top of crust.
Take next crust, repeat by rolling dough to fit over top of filling. Cut off all remaining pie crust on side just leaving crust to cover all the filling. With fork pierce top, brush with milk.
Oven 350 for 20 minutes or until golden brown.
Cool. Sprinkle with confectionary sugar. Cut into squares.

notes: If you want a larger amount, double recipe and use 13 by 9 pan. You can still use ready crust but will have to piece together.

recipes.title: Carrot Cake
recipes.description: Classic carrot cake with cream cheese frosting.

instructions.text: Mix flour, sugar, baking soda, cinnamon and salt.
Add oil and eggs. Mix well.
Fold in grated carrots and pecans if using.
Pour into greased 9x13 pan or two 9-inch round pans.
Bake at 350°F until toothpick comes out clean.
For frosting: Beat cream cheese and butter until smooth. Add powdered sugar and vanilla. Beat until fluffy.
Frost cooled cake.

recipes.title: Dump Cake
recipes.description: A simple layered dessert - just dump the ingredients in order and bake!

instructions.text: Do NOT grease pan.
Dump pineapple (with juice) into bottom of pan and spread.
Spread coconut across the pineapple layer.
Spread cherry pie filling over coconut.
Sprinkle dry cake mix evenly over the top.
Scatter pecans over cake mix.
Slice butter into squares and place over top of mix.
Bake at 350°F until golden brown on top.

notes: Do not stir layers - just dump and spread each one.

assumptions: cherry pie filling: used default unit
yellow or white cake mix: used default unit
butter or margarine: used default unit

recipes.title: Pumpkin Sheet Cookies
recipes.description: Soft pumpkin cookies baked in a sheet pan with cream cheese frosting.

instructions.text: Mix pumpkin, sugar, salt, pumpkin pie spice, oil, and eggs.
Add dry cake mix and vanilla. Mix well.
Fold in nuts if using.
Spread in greased sheet pan.
Bake until done.
For frosting: Beat cream cheese and butter until smooth.
Add powdered sugar and orange zest. Beat until fluffy.
Frost cooled cookies. Cut into squares.

flags: Frosting ingredients were missing - added standard cream cheese frosting

assumptions: pumpkin pie spice: used default unit
yellow cake mix: used default unit

recipes.title: Pound Cake
recipes.description: Classic Southern pound cake with sour cream.

instructions.text: Grease and flour tube pan.
Cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each.
Sift flour with baking powder.
Add flour mixture alternately with sour cream, beginning and ending with flour.
Stir in vanilla.
Pour into prepared pan.
Bake at 325°F for 1-1/2 hours or until toothpick comes out clean.

recipes.title: Banana Pudding (Bobby Jones)
recipes.description: Classic Southern banana pudding with vanilla wafers and whipped cream.

instructions.text: Dump in bowl with 2 cups milk, beat to firm.
Fold in sour cream.
Fold in whipped cream.
Fold in sliced bananas.
Fold in vanilla wafers.
Refrigerate until ready to serve.

assumptions: vanilla instant pudding: used default unit

recipes.title: Angel Delight
recipes.description: A layered dessert with angel food cake, strawberries, and Jello.

instructions.text: Mix Jello as directed on box.
Put angel food cake squares in bottom of 13x9 dish.
Layer strawberries over cake.
Pour Jello over entire cake and strawberries.
Cover with foil, put in refrigerator until set.
When ready to serve, put Cool Whip over dish. Cut into squares.

recipes.title: Praline Lace Sundaes
recipes.description: Crispy lace cookies shaped into cups and filled with ice cream and praline sauce.

instructions.text: In a saucepan, combine butter, sugar, molasses, cinnamon and orange rind. Bring to a boil.
Remove from heat. Stir in flour. Mix until smooth.
On a large ungreased cookie sheet, drop mixture by tablespoon, making only 2 at a time to allow for spacing.

Bake at 325°F for 12 minutes or until a rich brown. Let cool for 30 to 60 seconds until mixture holds together when moved with spatula. Loosen and place over custard cups. Press gently to mold. Repeat with remaining mixture.
To make sauce, combine all ingredients in a saucepan. Bring to a boil. Cook 3 minutes or until thickened.
Place one scoop ice cream into each cooled cup. Drizzle with hot sauce.

notes: Cups may be made ahead of time. Store in an airtight tin until ready to serve. Sauce may also be made ahead and reheated
Variations: Use lemon sherbet, coffee-flavored or butter-pecan ice cream

assumptions: grated orange rind: used default unit
vanilla ice cream: used default unit

recipes.title: Alan's Basic Flan
recipes.description: Classic caramelized custard flan with vanilla.

instructions.text: To prepare caramelized sugar, in a heavy saucepan, mix sugar and water. Cook over medium-high heat until dark golden in color, 10 to 12 minutes. Mixture should not exceed 340°F on candy thermometer. Remove from heat. Carefully swirl into a 9 1/2-by-2 1/2-inch 5-cup ring mold.
In a 2 1/2-quart saucepan, add milk, half-and-half, cream and vanilla bean. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat. Cool 5 minutes, whisking frequently.
In a large stainless steel or glass bowl, whisk eggs lightly. Gradually whisk in sugar.
Very slowly add milk mixture to egg mixture, beating continuously.
Add vanilla and rum. Mix. Remove beans. Pour into mold. Place in a roasting pan. Fill pan with water 1/2-inch deep.
Bake at 325°F for 45 to 50 minutes. To test for doneness, stick a knife in center. If it comes out clean, flan is done.
Remove mold from pan. Spoon remaining caramelized sugar over top. Cool. Chill 1 1/2 to 2 hours.

notes: Use a candy thermometer when cooking the caramelized sugar. If it cooks too hot or too long it will turn brown and have a burnt flavor

recipes.title: Black Cherry Tart
recipes.description: Elegant cherry tart with cream cheese and graham cracker crust.

instructions.text: Combine cracker crumbs, almonds and cinnamon. Stir in butter. Evenly press mixture into the bottom of an 8-inch tart pan with removable bottom. Bake at 300°F for 15 minutes. Cool.
Beat together cream cheese and honey. Spread evenly over crust.
Cut cherries in half. Arrange, cut-side down, on cheese layer.
In a saucepan, combine 8 tablespoons cherry liquid and cornstarch. Stir in jelly and lemon juice until well combined.
Bring to a boil over low heat, stirring constantly. Reduce heat. Simmer 2 minutes longer or until thickened.
Spoon hot glaze over cherries to cover completely. Chill 2 to 4 hours.

notes: If you need to save time, you may purchase a pre-made graham cracker crust and use canned cherry pie filling to cover the cream cheese layer. For a more spirited flavor, add 1 to 2 tablespoons Kirsch to the glaze

assumptions: soft cream cheese: used default unit
graham cracker crumbs: used default unit

recipes.title: Banana Chocolate Cake
recipes.description: Moist chocolate cake with mashed bananas and cream cheese frosting.

instructions.text: To prepare frosting, cream butter until light. Blend in 1 cup powdered sugar mixture into mashed banana. Gradually add enough powdered sugar until of spreading consistency. Add banana extract. Blend well. Set aside.
In bowl, cream shortening and sugar. Beat in eggs, one at a time.
Mix cocoa with hot water. Blend into creamed mixture.
Sift together flour, soda and salt. Alternately add dry ingredients and mashed bananas to creamed mixture.
Turn batter into 2 greased 8-inch square pans lined with waxed paper.
Bake at 375°F for 35 minutes or until tester comes out clean and cake pulls from sides of pan. Cool completely. Layer.
Frost tops of each layer.
Cut into squares.

notes: For best results, use very soft, ripe bananas; gently mash them with a fork

flags: Bananas clarified: 2 for cake, 1 for frosting
Cook time corrected to 35 min (was inconsistent)

assumptions: sifted cake flour: used default unit
sifted powdered sugar: used default unit

recipes.title: White Chocolate Chunk Cookies
recipes.description: Buttery cookies studded with white chocolate chunks and walnuts.

instructions.text: In a bowl, combine flour, baking soda and salt.
In a large mixing bowl, cream together butter and sugars until smooth. Add vanilla and egg. Beat until light.
Add flour mixture, chopped chocolate and walnuts. Blend well.
Shape cookies by rounded teaspoonfuls onto ungreased baking sheets.
Bake at 375°F for 8 to 10 minutes until golden.

notes: These cookies are also delicious made with semisweet or milk chocolate chips

recipes.title: Old-Fashioned Butter Cake
recipes.description: Classic dense, moist butter cake made with buttermilk.

instructions.text: In a large bowl, beat together butter and sugar until fluffy.
Beat in vanilla. One at a time, add eggs, beating well after each addition.
In a separate bowl, combine flour, baking soda and salt. Alternately with buttermilk, add to batter, beginning and ending with flour mixture.
Pour batter into a buttered, floured 8-cup fluted pan.
Bake at 350°F for about 1 1/2 hours until tester inserted in center comes out clean.
Allow cake to stand 5 minutes. Remove from pan. Finish cooling on rack.
Dust with powdered sugar.

notes: To easily cream together butter and sugar, use a wooden spoon to press the beat or mixture until the sides of the bowl. Do not overbeat or mixture will curdle and cake will be tough
Good served with hot chocolate, coffee or tea and a scoop of butter-pecan ice cream

recipes.title: Melting Moments
recipes.description: Delicate butter cookies that melt in your mouth, topped with cream cheese icing.

instructions.text: In a mixing bowl, beat butter at low speed until creamy. Slowly add cornstarch and powdered sugar. Turn speed to medium-high. Beat until fluffy.
With wooden spoon, stir in flour. Dough should be quite soft.
Cover. Chill for 45 minutes.
To prepare frosting, blend cream cheese with powdered sugar until creamy and smooth. Mixture will be stiff. Mix in vanilla. Add a few drops of food coloring. Mix well.
Roll dough into 24 1-inch balls. Place 1 1/2 inches apart on ungreased cookie sheets. With finger, press a slight indentation on the top of each cookie.
Bake at 350°F for 10-12 minutes until cookies feel firm but are not browned.
Cool. Top each cookie with a spoonful of icing. Garnish with sliced almonds.

notes: Stir dry ingredients after measuring. In place of the vanilla extract, almond or peppermint may be used. The dough may be prepared one day in advance and refrigerated. Bring to room temperature before shaping cookies

assumptions: soft cream cheese: used default unit
red or green food coloring: used default unit

recipes.title: Pineapple Dream Cake
recipes.description: Light and fluffy cake with pineapple and whipped cream frosting.

instructions.text: Line 9-inch cake pans with foil.
In a large mixing bowl, beat all cake ingredients at medium speed for 4 minutes.
Bake at 350°F for 20 to 25 minutes until cake tester comes out clean and cake pulls from sides of pan. Cool completely.
Invert one layer on flat plate or cake platter. Peel off foil.
To prepare icing, in small mixing bowl, beat pudding mix, pineapple until thick, in a large spoon whipped non-dairy topping. Fold in pineapple mixture.
Ice top of each cake. Layer. Ice sides. Refrigerate cake until ready to serve.

notes: Be sure to line cake pans with foil and grease well as the batter will be very greasy. This cake freezes well. For a special occasion, use another 11 oz. can mandarin oranges to decorate. Be sure cake is well drained and dried before using

assumptions: mandarin orange slices: used default unit
vanilla instant pudding mix: used default unit
non-dairy whipped topping: used default unit

recipes.title: Fruit Pie in Cookie Crust
recipes.description: Fresh fruit pie with a sweet cookie-style crust.

ingredients.item: diced fresh sliced or assorted fruit

instructions.text: To prepare crust, in a bowl, combine butter, sugar and egg yolk. Mix well. Add flour. With hands, work until blended. Press dough firmly on bottom and sides of a 9-inch pie pan. Bake at 400°F for 10 minutes or until edges brown. Cool.
In a heavy saucepan, combine sugar, cornstarch and salt.
Gradually stir in apple juice. Bring to boil over medium heat. Cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Remove from heat.
Stir in lemon rind and lemon juice.
Gently fold in fruit. Turn into cookie crust. Chill for 4 to 5 hours until firm enough to cut.

notes: Sliced or diced fresh apples, pears, strawberries, grapes, bananas and drained orange sections all work well in this recipe
Good served with a scoop of vanilla ice cream

assumptions: grated lemon rind: used default unit
diced fresh sliced or assorted fruit: used default unit

recipes.title: Walnut Chocolate Fudge
recipes.description: Rich chocolate fudge made with apple juice and topped with walnuts.

instructions.text: In a 3-quart saucepan, combine sugar, water and apple juice. Over medium heat, cook, stirring until sugar is dissolved.
Cook until syrup reaches soft-ball stage, 234°F.
Remove from heat. Whisk in chocolate. Blend well. Stir in walnuts.
Spread mixture in foil-lined baking pan. Chill until set.
Turn fudge out of pan. Peel off foil. Cut into squares.

notes: For best results, use an accurate candy thermometer. To store fudge, cover and place in a cool, dry place

assumptions: semisweet chocolate pieces: used default unit
coarsely chopped walnuts: used default unit

recipes.title: Chocolate Strawberry Shortcake
recipes.description: Chocolate shortcake layered with ricotta cheese filling and fresh strawberries.

instructions.text: In a medium bowl, stir together flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking soda and salt.
With a pastry blender, cut in the butter until mixture resembles cornmeal.
In another bowl, combine cream, vanilla and egg. Add to flour mixture. Stir just until moistened. Mixture will be stiff.
Spread mixture in two greased 8- or 9-inch round cake pans.
Bake at 425°F for 10 to 12 minutes until a wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean. Immediately turn out layers onto wire racks. Cool.
For filling, stir together Ricotta cheese, sugar, vanilla and chocolate chips.
Place one cake layer on a serving plate. Spread with half the filling. Layer cake with remaining filling. Garnish with sliced berries.

assumptions: unsweetened cocoa powder: used default unit

recipes.title: Cinnamon Mocha Sheet Cake
recipes.description: Moist chocolate sheet cake flavored with cinnamon and espresso.

instructions.text: In saucepan, melt butter. Stir in cocoa, water and coffee. Beat until smooth.
In a large bowl, combine sugar, flour, eggs and milk. Add cocoa mixture. Mix well.
To cocoa mixture, combine sugar, flour, cinnamon and baking soda.
Pour batter into a greased 10-by-15-inch jelly roll pan.
Bake at 350°F for 18 minutes or until done.
To prepare icing, in a saucepan, melt butter. Stir in coffee. Cook, stirring, until smooth. Slowly beat in powdered sugar. Mix until smooth. Spread over cake while warm. Cool. Cut into squares.

notes: Good served with a scoop of coffee or vanilla-flavored ice cream

assumptions: instant espresso or coffee crystals: used default unit
sifted powdered sugar: used default unit

recipes.title: Caramel Crunch Bars
recipes.description: Buttery shortbread bars topped with caramel and almonds.

instructions.text: In a large mixing bowl, cream butter and sugar. Add egg yolks and vanilla. Stir in flour and salt.
Press dough into a greased and floured 15 3/4-by-10 1/2-inch jelly roll pan.
Bake at 350°F for 25 to 30 minutes until golden.
To prepare topping, in heavy saucepan, combine lemon juice, sugar and cream. Stir over high heat until sugar is dissolved.
Add butter. With rubber scraper, clean down the sides of the pan.
Continue cooking until mixture turns a light caramel color or until a few drops in cold water form a soft ball.
Remove from heat. Add nuts and vanilla.
Pour over baked crust. Return to oven for 2 to 5 minutes until topping bubbles.
Cool. Cut into 1-by-2-inch bars.

recipes.title: Crumb-Topped Blueberry Cake
recipes.description: Moist coffee cake loaded with blueberries and topped with walnut streusel.

instructions.text: In a large bowl, combine flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda and salt. Blend well.
In a large measuring cup, combine eggs, milk, butter and lemon juice. Add to dry ingredients. Mix well.
To prepare topping, in a bowl, combine flour, sugar, butter and walnuts. Blend until mixture is crumbly in appearance.
Turn batter into a buttered 13-by-9-inch baking dish. Sprinkle with blueberries evenly over batter. Sprinkle with topping.
Bake at 375°F for 40 to 45 minutes. Serve warm.

notes: If using frozen blueberries, do not thaw

recipes.title: Peanutty Chocolate Pie
recipes.description: No-bake chocolate peanut butter pie with graham cracker crust.

instructions.text: For Filling: In 2-quart saucepan combine sugar and corn starch. Stirring constantly, bring to boil over medium heat and boil 1 minute. Remove from heat.
Stir in chocolate until smooth. Pour into pie crust. Refrigerate 45 minutes or until cool.

For Topping: In small bowl combine heavy cream and 1/4 cup sugar. With mixer at low speed, blend in 2 tbsp peanut butter until smooth. Beat at medium speed until cream stands in peaks; spread over chocolate layer. Sprinkle with chopped peanuts.
Serve immediately or cover and refrigerate.

assumptions: Argo or Kingsford's Corn Starch: used default unit
semisweet chocolate chips: used default unit
prepared graham cracker crust: used default unit

recipes.title: Strawberry Shortcut Cake
recipes.description: Quick strawberry cake with marshmallow and whipped cream topping.

instructions.text: Generously grease bottom only of a 13x9-inch baking pan; sprinkle marshmallows evenly over bottom of pan. Thoroughly combine completely thawed strawberries and syrup. Thoroughly set aside. (No need to sift flour, measure by lightly spooning into cup and leveling off.) In large mixer bowl, combine remaining ingredients. Blend at low speed until moistened; beat 3 minutes at medium speed, scraping sides of bowl occasionally. Spoon batter evenly over marshmallows in prepared pan. Pour strawberry mixture evenly over batter.
Bake at 350° for 45 to 50 minutes until golden brown and toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.
Serve warm or cool with ice cream or whipped cream.

notes: For use with Pillsbury's Best Self-Rising Flour, omit baking powder and salt.
HIGH ALTITUDE—5200 feet. Decrease baking powder to 2 1/2 teaspoons. Bake at 375° for 40 to 45 minutes.

assumptions: frozen strawberries in syrup: used default unit
strawberry flavored gelatin: used default unit
Pillsbury's Best All Purpose Flour: used default unit

recipes.title: No-Bake Easter Basket Cake
recipes.description: Adorable Easter basket cake made with frozen pound cakes, decorated with bunny cookies and candy.

instructions.text: In bowl set over hot, not simmering water, melt white chocolate with shortening until smooth. Dip 1 side of 1 peanut-shaped cookie in mixture; place dipped side up on wire rack. Press 1 cake decor into icing for nose. Repeat with remaining cookies. Let stand until dry, 15-20 minutes. Roll out each Starburst to a 1/4-inch thick. With clean scissors cut two 1 1/2-inch-long bunny ears. Cut 2 small slits on 1 short side of cookie through to cookie filling. Dip tip of 2 ears into remaining chocolate mixture; insert dipped tips into slits. Transfer semisweet chocolate to plastic food storage bag with corner snipped; pipe eyes and whiskers.

Tint frosting pink with red food coloring. Transfer 1 1/2 cups frosting to plastic food storage bag; set aside. With small amount of frosting attach bottom of 1 pound-cake to serving platter. Attach another cake to first cake with frosting on bottom and 1 vertical side. From vertical side. Attach remaining cakes with frosting as shown. Frost top and sides with remaining frosting.

In bowl toss coconut with green food coloring and a few drops of water; set aside. Press some of M&M's along bottom edge of cake in alternating colors. Press Cookie Stix vertically onto sides of cakes, fitting bottom tip of cookies in crevice formed where 2 M&M's meet. Leave 1 1/2-inch vertical gap on each long side of cake for handle. Press remaining M&M's along top edge of cake in alternating colors. Snip corner of bag of reserved pink frosting; pipe alternating horizontal lines over cookies for basket weave, as shown. Press Bunny Rope onto sides of cake for handle; insert toothpicks through rope into cake to secure. For extra stability prop handle up with toothpicks or long wooden skewer until cake is served. Insert bunny cookies into top of cake (cookies can also help hold up handle). Arrange coconut over candy around cookies.
Basket handle alternative: If you are unable to find Marshmallow Bunny Ropes, flexible straws cut to fit, then threaded with marshmallows and inserted into each other can be used instead, as shown.

notes: Quick Tip: If you're allergic to peanuts, substitute pastel-colored plain M&M's for the peanut variety, plain Cookie Stix for the peanut-flavored and chocolate candy bunnies for the peanut bunny cookies.

assumptions: frozen pound cakes: used default unit
peanut butter-flavored Keebler Cookie Stix: used default unit
multicolored marshmallow rope: used default unit
flexible straws and large marshmallows: used default unit

recipes.title: Frosty Orange Delight
recipes.description: Frozen orange cream dessert with a cookie crust.

ingredients.item: baked crust made with coconut cream pudding and pie filling mix

ingredients.prep_note: whipped and sweetened with 1/4 cup sugar

ingredients.item: powdered orange flavored instant breakfast drink

instructions.text: In large mixer bowl, combine cream cheese, powdered instant breakfast drink, and sugar at low speed; beat 3 minutes at high speed until smooth and creamy.
Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Fold in whipped cream and drained mandarin oranges; pour over baked and cooled crust.
Freeze covered with foil, overnight. Remove from freezer 10 minutes before serving.

notes: Basic Crust: 1 cup flour, 1 package (4-serving size) pudding and pie filling mix (not instant), 1/4 tsp salt, 1/3 cup solid shortening, 2 tbsp butter softened, 1 egg. Blend 30 seconds at low speed; blend 1 minute at medium speed. Spread in ungreased 13x9-inch pan. Bake at 350° for 12-15 minutes. Cool completely.

assumptions: powdered orange flavored instant breakfast drink: used default unit

recipes.title: Berry Banana Dessert
recipes.description: Layered frozen dessert with raspberries, bananas, and cream cheese.

ingredients.item: baked crust made with coconut cream pudding and pie filling mix

instructions.text: In large saucepan, combine miniature marshmallows, gelatin, and reserved raspberry syrup. Cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until marshmallows are melted.
Chill while preparing cream cheese mixture. In large mixer bowl, combine honey, cream cheese and vanilla at low speed; beat 3 minutes at high speed until smooth and creamy.
Add yogurt and reserved marshmallow mixture; beat at medium speed 1 minute. Slice bananas and spoon drained raspberries over baked and cooled crust.
Pour filling over fruit. Refrigerate 3 hours or until set.

notes: Tip: If desired, 1 cup fresh raspberries sweetened with 1/4 cup sugar can be used for the frozen raspberries, using 1 cup water for raspberry syrup.

assumptions: raspberry flavored or vanilla yogurt: used default unit
red raspberry flavored gelatin: used default unit

recipes.title: Strawberries 'n Cream Cheese Freeze
recipes.description: Frozen strawberry cream cheese dessert with lemon pudding crust.

ingredients.item: baked crust made with lemon pudding and pie filling mix

ingredients.prep_note: whipped and sweetened with 1/4 cup sugar

instructions.text: In large mixer bowl, combine cream cheese and sugar at low speed; beat at high speed for 3 minutes until smooth and creamy. Add reserved syrup; beat 1 minute at medium speed.
Fold in strawberries and whipped cream; pour over baked and cooled crust.
Freeze covered with foil overnight. Remove from freezer 10 minutes before serving.
Tip: If desired, 1 pint fresh strawberries, mashed and sweetened with 1/3 cup sugar can be used for the frozen strawberries. Use juice from mashed fresh strawberries for strawberry syrup.

recipes.title: Original Nestle Toll House Chocolate Chip Cookies
recipes.source_note: Nestle Toll House chocolate chip bag
recipes.description: The classic original chocolate chip cookie recipe.

ingredients.item: Nestle Toll House Semi-Sweet Chocolate Morsels

instructions.text: Combine flour, baking soda and salt in small bowl. Beat butter, granulated sugar, brown sugar and vanilla in large mixer bowl. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Gradually beat in flour mixture. Stir in morsels and nuts. Drop by rounded tablespoon onto ungreased baking sheets.
Bake in preheated 375°F oven for 9 to 11 minutes or until golden brown. Let stand for 2 minutes; remove to wire racks to cool completely.

notes: Pan Cookie Variation: Prepare dough as above. Spread into greased 15 x 10-inch jelly-roll pan. Bake in preheated 375°F oven for 20 to 25 minutes or until golden brown. Cool in pan on wire rack. Makes about 4 dozen bars.

For High Altitude Baking (5,200 feet): Increase flour to 2 1/2 cups. Add 2 teaspoons water with flour and reduce both granulated sugar and brown sugar to 2/3 cup each. Bake at 375°F, drop cookies for 8 to 10 minutes and pan cookie for 17 to 19 minutes.

assumptions: Nestle Toll House Semi-Sweet Chocolate Morsels: used default unit

recipes.title: Famous Fudge
recipes.source_note: Nestle Toll House chocolate chip bag
recipes.description: Classic creamy chocolate fudge with marshmallows.

ingredients.item: Nestle Toll House Semi-Sweet Chocolate Morsels

instructions.text: Combine butter, evaporated milk, sugar and salt in medium, heavy saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly.
Boil for 4 to 5 minutes, stirring constantly. Remove from heat.
Stir in morsels, nuts and vanilla. Stir vigorously for 1 minute or until marshmallows are melted.
Pour into foil-lined 8-inch square baking pan; chill until firm.

assumptions: Nestle Toll House Semi-Sweet Chocolate Morsels: used default unit

recipes.title: Old Fashioned Oatmeal Cookies
recipes.source_note: Nestle Toll House chocolate chip bag
recipes.description: Classic oatmeal cookies with chocolate chips.

ingredients.item: Nestle Toll House Semi-Sweet Chocolate Morsels

instructions.text: Combine flour, baking soda and salt in small bowl. Beat butter, granulated sugar, brown sugar and vanilla in large mixer bowl until creamy.
Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Gradually beat in flour mixture. Stir in morsels and oats.
Drop by rounded tablespoon onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake in preheated 350°F oven for 8 to 11 minutes or until golden brown. Let stand for 2 minutes; remove to wire racks to cool completely.

assumptions: butter or margarine: used default unit
Nestle Toll House Semi-Sweet Chocolate Morsels: used default unit

recipes.title: Ultimate Chocolate Chocolate Chip Cookies
recipes.source_note: Nestle Toll House chocolate chip bag
recipes.description: Double chocolate cookies with melted chocolate in the batter.

ingredients.item: Nestle Toll House Semi-Sweet Chocolate Morsels

instructions.text: Melt 2 cups morsels in small, heavy saucepan over lowest possible heat. When morsels begin to melt, remove from heat; stir. Return to heat for a few seconds at a time, stirring until smooth. Combine flour, baking soda and salt in medium bowl.

Beat butter, brown sugar, granulated sugar and vanilla in large mixer bowl. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Beat in melted chocolate. Gradually beat in flour mixture. Stir in remaining morsels.
Drop by rounded tablespoon onto ungreased baking sheets.
Bake in preheated 375°F oven for 8 to 9 minutes or until cookies are puffed. Cool for 2 minutes; remove to wire racks to cool completely.

assumptions: Nestle Toll House Semi-Sweet Chocolate Morsels: used default unit
butter or margarine: used default unit

recipes.title: Easy Double Chocolate Chip Brownies
recipes.source_note: Nestle Toll House chocolate chip bag
recipes.description: Fudgy brownies loaded with chocolate chips.

ingredients.item: Nestle Toll House Semi-Sweet Chocolate Morsels

instructions.text: Melt 1 cup morsels and butter in large, heavy saucepan over low heat; stir until smooth. Remove from heat. Add eggs; stir well. Add flour, sugar, baking soda and vanilla; stir well.
Stir in remaining morsels and nuts. Spread to greased 13 x 9-inch baking pan.
Bake in preheated 350°F oven for 16 to 20 minutes or until wooden pick inserted in center comes out slightly sticky. Cool completely.

assumptions: Nestle Toll House Semi-Sweet Chocolate Morsels: used default unit
butter or margarine: used default unit

recipes.title: Yuletide Toffee Squares
recipes.description: Chewy oat toffee bars topped with chocolate and nuts - perfect for the holidays.
recipes.source_note: Nestle Toll House chocolate chip bag

instructions.text: Heat oven to 400°F. Grease 15x10-inch jelly roll pan.
Combine oats, brown sugar, margarine, corn syrup, vanilla and salt; mix well.
Firmly press mixture into prepared pan.
Bake about 18 minutes or until mixture is brown and bubbly.
Remove from oven. Immediately sprinkle chocolate morsels evenly over toffee.
Let stand 10 minutes. Spread chocolate evenly over toffee; sprinkle with nuts.
Cool completely. Cut into squares.

notes: Store tightly covered in cool, dry place.

assumptions: semi-sweet chocolate morsels: used default unit

recipes.title: Make-Ahead Cookie Mix
recipes.description: A make-ahead refrigerator cookie mix base. Add eggs, sugar, and flavorings to make various cookies. See notes for recipe variations.

ingredients.prep_note: Pillsbury's Best Unbleached or All Purpose

instructions.text: In very large bowl, combine butter, salt, and baking powder; using electric mixer, blend well.
Lightly spoon flour into measuring cup; level off. Add flour to bowl, scraping bowl often.
Store tightly covered in refrigerator up to 4 weeks (6 cups mix).

notes: Mix can be stored up to 4 weeks!
HIGH ALTITUDE: 5200 FEET, NO CHANGE. If using Pillsbury's Best Self-Rising Flour, omit baking powder and salt. Decrease flour by 1/2 cup.
[RECONSTRUCTED VARIATIONS - original reverse side not scanned]
SUGAR COOKIES: 2 cups mix + 1 cup sugar + 1 egg + 1 tsp vanilla. Roll into balls, flatten with fork. Bake 375°F for 8-10 minutes.
PEANUT BUTTER COOKIES: 2 cups mix + 3/4 cup sugar + 1/2 cup peanut butter + 1 egg. Roll into balls, press with fork. Bake 375°F for 10-12 minutes.
JAM THUMBPRINTS: 2 cups mix + 1/2 cup powdered sugar + 1 egg yolk + 1 tsp vanilla. Roll into balls, press thumb in center, fill with jam. Bake 350°F for 12-15 minutes.
BUTTER BALLS: 2 cups mix + 1/2 cup powdered sugar + 1 cup finely chopped nuts + 1 tsp vanilla. Roll into balls. Bake 325°F for 15-18 minutes. Roll in powdered sugar while warm.

flags: magazine clipping - image upside down, some text obscured
INCOMPLETE: Original companion cookie recipes from reverse side not available
Common variations added based on standard butter-flour mix formulas

assumptions: butter or margarine: used default unit

recipes.title: Basic Crust
recipes.description: A simple crust for desserts, from a Pillsbury Bake-Off winner.

ingredients.item: vanilla pudding and pie filling mix

instructions.text: No need to sift flour; measure by lightly spooning into cup and leveling off.
In small mixer bowl, combine all ingredients. Blend at low speed; blend 1 minute at medium speed.
Knead to form smooth ball.
Roll and press into ungreased 13x9-inch oblong pan.
Bake at 350° for 12 to 15 minutes. Cool completely.

notes: For use with Pillsbury's Best Self-Rising Flour, omit salt and the 2 tablespoons butter.

assumptions: vanilla pudding and pie filling mix: used default unit
butter or margarine: used default unit

recipes.title: Honey Wallbanger Cake
recipes.description: A moist cake made with orange cake mix, Galliano liqueur, and a sweet glaze.

instructions.text: Mix cake mix, pudding, eggs, oil, and Galliano.
Pour into greased bundt pan.
Bake at 350°F for 45 minutes.

notes: Frosting: Mix 1 cup confectioners sugar with 1 Tbsp Galliano. Drizzle over cooled cake.

flags: Partial transcription from worn newspaper clipping

assumptions: orange cake mix: used default unit
instant vanilla pudding: used default unit

recipes.title: Quaker Chewy Choc-Oat-Chip Cookies

ingredients.item: QUAKER Oats (quick or old fashioned), uncooked

instructions.text: Heat oven to 375°F. Beat together margarine and sugars until creamy. Add eggs, milk and vanilla; beat well.
Add combined flour, baking soda, salt and oats; mix well. Stir in chocolate pieces and nuts (optional).
Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheet; 9 to 10 cookies per sheet.
Bake 12 to 13 minutes for a crispy cookie or 10 to 11 minutes for a chewy cookie.
Cool 1 minute on cookie sheet; remove to wire rack. Cool completely. Store tightly covered.

notes: For Easy Bar Cookies: Press dough onto bottom of 13 x 9-inch baking sheet. Bake 30 to 35 minutes or until light golden brown. Cool completely; cut into bars. Makes 32 bars.
High Altitude Adjustments: Increase flour to 2 cups and bake as directed.

assumptions: firmly packed brown sugar: used default unit
QUAKER Oats (quick or old fashioned), uncooked: used default unit
semi-sweet chocolate pieces: used default unit

ingredients.item: QUAKER Oats (quick or old fashioned), uncooked

instructions.text: Heat oven to 375°F. Lightly grease baking sheet with Butter Flavor Crisco.
Combine Butter Flavor Crisco, brown sugar, egg, milk and vanilla in large bowl. Beat at medium speed of electric mixer until well blended.
Combine oats, flour, baking soda, salt and cinnamon. Mix into creamed mixture. Stir in raisins and nuts.
Drop rounded tablespoonfuls of dough 2 inches apart onto baking sheet.
Bake for 10 to 12 minutes, or until lightly browned.
Cool 2 minutes on cooling rack.

QUAKER Oats (quick or old fashioned), uncooked: used default unit

recipes.title: Peaches-and-Cream Ice Cream

instructions.text: Combine 2-1/2 cups 1% low-fat milk and egg yolks in a large heavy saucepan, and stir well with whisk.
Cook over medium heat 10 minutes or until mixture thickens and coats a spoon, stirring constantly (do not boil).
Combine egg yolk mixture, remaining 2-1/2 cups 1% low-fat milk, peaches, and next five ingredients in a large bowl; stir well.
Cover and chill completely.
Pour mixture into the freezer can of an ice cream freezer, and freeze according to manufacturer's instructions.
Spoon ice cream into a large freezer-safe container, cover and freeze 12 hours or until firm.
Garnish with mint sprigs, if desired.

notes: Chill Time: 12+ hours

assumptions: PUBLIX 1% low-fat milk: used default unit
peeled, mashed ripe peaches: used default unit
fat-free sweetened condensed skim milk: used default unit

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°F. Butter and sugar a 1-1/2 quart souffle dish.
Beat egg yolks with half the sugar until thick and pale. Stir in vanilla.
In separate bowl, beat egg whites with cream of tartar and salt until soft peaks form. Gradually add remaining sugar, beating until stiff peaks form.
Fold egg whites into yolk mixture in three additions.
Pour into prepared dish. Bake 25-30 minutes until puffed and golden. Serve immediately.
Dissolve orange gelatin in boiling water.
Add sherbet; stir until dissolved. Chill until almost firm.
Fold in fruit and marshmallows.
Fill 6 dessert dishes; chill until firm.

assumptions: orange flavored gelatin: used default unit
Kraft Miniature Marshmallows: used default unit

instructions.text: Heat oven to 375°F.
Combine flour, baking soda and salt in small bowl. Beat butter, granulated sugar, brown sugar and vanilla in large mixer bowl. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Gradually beat in flour mixture. Stir in chocolate pieces and nuts.
Drop by rounded tablespoon onto ungreased baking sheets.
Bake 9 to 11 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on baking sheets 2 minutes; remove to wire rack to cool completely.

assumptions: Pillsbury BEST All Purpose Flour: used default unit
semi-sweet chocolate pieces: used default unit

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°F. Grease a cookie sheet.
In small bowl, stir together sugar and almond flavoring; cover and set aside.
In medium bowl, combine 1 cup butter, cream cheese and egg yolk. Blend until smooth; beat with 1 tablespoon egg white for glazing. Roll or press dough into a 12x12-inch square.
Spread with 1 tablespoon egg white. Brush with slightly beaten egg white. Cut into 24 sticks. Place on cookie sheet. Brush surface with egg white; roll in sugar mixture to cover all sides.
Bake in 350°F oven for about 20 to 30 minutes until golden brown. Cool completely.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°F. Grease bottom and sides of 13x9 or 15x10-inch pan.

Remove from oven and sprinkle with chocolate pieces and nuts. Blend 3 tablespoons flour with caramel. Spread over the mixture evenly.

Cool. Cut into bars. Chill. Store in refrigerator.

assumptions: Pillsbury BEST All Purpose Flour: used default unit
firmly packed brown sugar: used default unit

Beat butter, granulated sugar, brown sugar and vanilla in large mixer bowl. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.

Boil for 4 to 5 minutes, stirring constantly. Marshmallows are melted. Remove from heat.
Stir vigorously for 1 minute or until marshmallows are melted. Stir in vanilla and nuts. Pour into foil-lined 8-inch square baking pan; chill until firm.

recipes.title: Busy Day Casserole
recipes.description: A quick and easy ground beef casserole.

instructions.text: Brown ground beef with onion; drain.
Mix in soups and vegetables.
Pour into casserole dish.
Top with tater tots.
Bake at 350°F for 30 minutes until bubbly and tots are golden.

assumptions: frozen mixed vegetables: used default unit

recipes.title: Chicken Breasts Roma
recipes.description: Italian-style chicken breasts with tomatoes and herbs.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Season chicken with Italian seasoning.
In skillet, sauté garlic in oil. Add chicken and brown on both sides.
Transfer to baking dish. Top with tomatoes, mushrooms and green pepper.
Bake 35 minutes. Top with cheese and bake 10 minutes more.

notes: Serve with pasta or rice.

recipes.title: Broiled Spring Chicken
recipes.description: Simple broiled chicken with herb butter and cheese.

ingredients.prep_note: plain, herbed, garlic or pepper flavored

instructions.text: With finger, make a pocket about 1-inch long between skin and meat of each chicken piece.
Divide cheese into 4 parts. Slide one piece of cheese into each pocket.
Sprinkle chicken on both sides with salt, pepper and paprika.
Place chicken on foil-lined baking pan. Brush with butter and lemon juice.
Place pan on center rack of broiler. Broil about 20 minutes per side, brushing occasionally with pan juices, turning once, until chicken is done. Serve immediately.

notes: Good served with buttered baby carrots, new potatoes and a tossed salad.

recipes.title: Herb-Grilled Chicken
recipes.description: Grilled chicken with fresh herb butter, basil and walnuts.

instructions.text: Split chickens in half. Cut off excess fat from tail areas. Remove backbone, if desired.
In a bowl, combine basil, garlic, walnuts, butter, 2 tablespoons oil, hot pepper sauce and pepper. Set aside 1 to 2 tablespoons of the mixture.
Loosen skin on chicken. Press remaining mixture evenly under skin, reaching as many areas of chicken as possible.
Place chicken, bone-side up, onto preheated grill. Grill 12 to 15 minutes.
Turn chicken. Grill 12 to 15 minutes longer. Brush skin-side with some of remaining butter mixture several times during cooking. Season with salt and pepper, if desired.
As chicken cooks, combine remaining herb butter, oil, lemon juice and wine. Brush some of the mixture onto bone-side of chicken.

notes: Good served with grilled potato wedges brushed with herb butter and grilled corn-on-the-cob.

assumptions: fresh basil leaves: used default unit
hot pepper sauce: used default unit

recipes.title: Joyce's Chicken
recipes.description: Simmered chicken with tomatoes, mushrooms and white wine.

instructions.text: In a large saucepan with cover, heat 1 tablespoon oil. Add chicken. Brown. Remove from pan.
To the pan, add remaining oil. Add onion and garlic. Sauté for 5 minutes. Add mushrooms. Cook 4 minutes longer.
Stir in green pepper, tomatoes, tomato paste, chicken broth, wine, basil and pepper. Cover. Simmer for 20 minutes.
Add chicken. Cover. Simmer gently for 25 minutes. Sprinkle generously with parsley. Serve immediately.

notes: Health Note: To reduce sodium, use low-salt chicken broth. Good served with a tossed salad and garlic bread.

flags: Black pepper corrected from 1/2 cup to 1/2 tsp (OCR error)

assumptions: chopped green pepper: used default unit
canned diced tomatoes with juice: used default unit

recipes.title: Corned Beef Hash Casserole
recipes.description: A hearty casserole topped with sliced eggs.

instructions.text: In a small skillet, melt butter. Add green pepper and onion. Cook until limp but not brown.
In a small bowl, combine sour cream, mustard, cayenne and black pepper. Add onion and green pepper. Mix well.
In a medium bowl, combine hash and sour cream mixture. Blend thoroughly.
Transfer mixture to large shallow casserole dish. Bake at 400°F until bubbly and lightly browned, about 25 minutes.
Arrange egg slices on top. Sprinkle with parsley.

notes: Tips: Poached eggs may be used instead of hard-boiled. For 8 servings, increase baking time to about 30 minutes.

assumptions: corned beef hash: used default unit

recipes.title: Deviled Cornish Hens
recipes.description: Roasted Cornish hens with a tangy basting sauce.

instructions.text: Wash hens thoroughly. Pat dry.
Rub hens inside and outside with salt, pepper and garlic.
Place hens side-by-side in roasting pan.
To prepare basting sauce, mix all ingredients together.

Roast hens at 375°F for about 50 minutes, basting occasionally with sauce until juices run clear. Cooking time will depend on size of birds. Check doneness by pricking thigh. When juices run clear, the hens are ready.
Garnish hens with watercress, if used.

notes: Good served with brown or wild rice, a tossed salad and French bread.

flags: Basting sauce ingredients were missing - added deviled-style sauce

recipes.title: Smoky Bacon Burgers
recipes.description: Juicy burgers wrapped in bacon with smoky flavor.

instructions.text: In a bowl, combine beef, egg, onion, salt, pepper and liquid smoke. Blend well. Divide mixture into quarters.
Shape each quarter into a thick patty. Wrap a strip of bacon around outside of each. Hold together with a toothpick.
Place burgers on oiled broiler rack. Broil 5-6 inches from heat for 5-8 minutes per side until done to your liking.
Place one lettuce leaf on each hamburger bun. Top each with a cooked patty. Add tomato. Remove toothpick.

notes: Tips: You may prepare the meat patties ahead of time. Cover and refrigerate until ready to broil. If desired, patties may be cooked over a charcoal grill. Good served with quartered, deep-fried, unpeeled potatoes.

assumptions: finely chopped onion: used default unit

recipes.title: Ham & Cheese Casserole
recipes.description: A hearty macaroni casserole with ham and cheese.

instructions.text: Cook noodles, drain.
Make white sauce with flour, milk, and butter.
Add all other ingredients and combine.
Top with crisp croutons or bread crumbs.
Bake at 350°F for 30 minutes.

recipes.title: Country-Style Ribs and Corn
recipes.description: Country-style pork back ribs baked together with potatoes.

instructions.text: Dust ribs with flour. Sprinkle with garlic salt.
In a heavy skillet, heat butter. Add ribs. Brown.
In a lightly oiled 13-by-9-inch baking dish, layer potatoes. Sprinkle with salt, black pepper, onion and green pepper. Pour milk over. Cover ribs in a single layer over vegetables.
Arrange browned ribs in a single layer over vegetables.
Cover. Bake at 350°F for 30 minutes. Remove cover. Bake 30 minutes longer or until ribs are tender and potatoes are cooked through.
Sprinkle with tomato and green onions. Serve immediately.

notes: Good served with a tossed green salad, rye bread, and red wine or beer, if desired.

assumptions: pork country-style back ribs: used default unit

recipes.title: Sirloin Steak in Marinade
recipes.description: Tender sirloin steak marinated in an Asian-inspired sauce.

instructions.text: Trim fat from meat. Place meat in a deep bowl.
In another bowl, combine marinade ingredients. Blend well.
Pour marinade over meat. Turn meat to coat all sides. Cover. Refrigerate 4 to 8 hours or overnight.
Place steak meat on a rack in a shallow roasting pan. Brush with marinade.
Roast at 450°F for 20 to 30 minutes for rare to medium-rare. After 5 minutes, brush with marinade. Baste meat often.
Remove meat from oven. Place on serving board. Let stand 10 minutes.
Carve into thin slices. Serve immediately.

notes: Good served with hot wild rice, stir-fried vegetables and rolls.

recipes.title: Barbecued Spareribs Orientale
recipes.description: Asian-style barbecued pork spareribs with honey and sake.

instructions.text: Cut ribs into 3 pieces. In large saucepan combine ribs, water, vinegar and sugar. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Simmer for 35 minutes. Drain.
In a bowl, combine soy sauce, pepper, honey, sake and garlic. Mix well.
Dip rib pieces into the mixture. Place on coals.
Grill meat, brushing often with sauce, for 30 minutes or until ribs are glazed and tender.
Brush cooked ribs with remaining sauce. Serve immediately.

notes: Good served with barbecued vegetables or steamed fresh vegetables and a tossed salad.
Recipe may be halved or doubled.
For 8-12 servings, use only 1½ times the sweet-and-sour broth.
You may precook spareribs ahead of time and simply heat and glaze over charcoal before serving.

assumptions: white wine vinegar: used default unit
sake or sweet sherry: used default unit

recipes.title: Sweet and Spicy Pot Roast
recipes.description: A different and delicious pot roast with an unusual combination of sweet and spicy flavors.

ingredients.item: blade cut or round bone pot roast

instructions.text: Place meat in baking dish with a cover. Season meat with onion salt, pepper, paprika and garlic salt, if used.
Cook, uncovered, at 350°F for 30 minutes. Turn. Bake 30 minutes longer.
In a bowl, mix together chili sauce and water. Pour over meat.
Pat brown sugar into top of meat. Stir some brown sugar into sauce.
Cover. Roast for about 2 hours, basting frequently.
Add vegetables and prunes. Continue cooking until meat and potatoes are tender. Baste meat often.
Carve meat. Place on serving dish. Pour sauce over all.

notes: This dish is just as delicious reheated the following day. To cook prunes, cover with water. Simmer about 30 minutes.

assumptions: blade cut or round bone pot roast: used default unit
bottle chili sauce: used default unit

recipes.title: Stuffed Peppers (Webb)

Put in pepper loosely: hamburger mixed with onions, garlic, egg, rice, and milk.
Put on top: 1 large can tomato Campbell's sauce condensed family soup.
Bake at 350 degrees.

recipes.title: Pork-Broccoli Delight
recipes.description: A creamy pork and broccoli casserole topped with croutons.

instructions.text: Drop broccoli into boiling salted water. Cook 2 minutes. Drain thoroughly.
Sprinkle croutons in bottom of shallow, buttered 1-1/2-quart casserole dish. Top with broccoli.
In a bowl, combine pork, mayonnaise and sour cream. Mix well.
Spread over broccoli. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.
Bake, uncovered, at 350°F for 20 minutes or until lightly browned.

notes: Health Note: To reduce fat, cholesterol and calories, use reduced-fat mayonnaise and light dairy sour cream.
Good served with: Tossed green or tomato salad.
Variations: You may substitute cooked asparagus for the broccoli and cooked cubed chicken for the pork.
Tips: To use fresh broccoli in place of frozen, break into flowerettes and parboil 2 minutes. Drain well. The casserole can be assembled ahead of time and refrigerated to be baked later.

assumptions: frozen broccoli spears: used default unit
grated Parmesan cheese: used default unit

recipes.title: Roast Leg of Lamb with Mint Sauce
recipes.description: Classic roast leg of lamb with homemade mint sauce.

instructions.text: Trim loose fat from lamb. Do not remove outer skin. Wipe meat with damp cloth.
Brush with oil. With small knife, make several slivers in meat. Insert garlic pieces into slivers. Sprinkle with rosemary.
Place lamb on a rack in a roasting pan, fat-side up.
Sear meat at 450° for 15 minutes. Reduce temperature to 350°F. Roast 1-1/2 to 2 hours until meat thermometer reads 160°F for slightly rare or 170°F or well done.
To prepare sauce, combine water and sugar in a saucepan. Heat until sugar is dissolved. Remove from heat. Stir in mint and vinegar. Set aside for 30 minutes. Strain. Cover. Chill.
Sprinkle lamb with salt and pepper. Let rest 20-30 minutes before carving. Serve sliced meat with mint sauce.

recipes.title: Swordfish with Steamed Vegetables

instructions.text: Dust fish with flour, salt and pepper.
In an ovenproof pan, melt butter in oil. Add fish. Sauté over medium heat until golden.
In a small bowl, combine zucchini, celery and onions. Top fish with vegetable mixture. Pour wine over all. Sprinkle with tarragon. Add salt to taste.
Cover. Bake at 425°F for 20 to 25 minutes until fish flakes and vegetables are tender-crisp. Sprinkle with walnuts.

notes: To simplify this recipe, place butter and oil in baking dish. Heat at 425°F until melted. Coat fish with mixture. Top with vegetables and bake. To toast walnuts, melt butter in skillet. Cook walnuts in butter about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Good served with: Brown rice pilaf, crisp rolls with herbed butter, and lemon pie for dessert.

assumptions: finely sliced green onions: used default unit
celery and sliced onions: used default unit

recipes.title: Pork Chops in Cider Sauce

instructions.text: Trim fat from pork.
In a medium to large skillet, heat butter. Add garlic. Cook until golden brown. Add meat. Brown on both sides.
Spread each chop generously with mustard. Sprinkle with sage and pepper. Repeat on other side of chops.
Add 1/2 cup cider. Cover. Cook slowly for 15 to 20 minutes, turning occasionally.
Remove cover. Add remaining cider. Cook rapidly until reduced to a sauce consistency.
Stir 1 tablespoon mustard into sauce. Pour over chops. Serve with apples.

notes: Sherried Apples: Cut 3 large red apples in sixths. Core but do not peel. Place in deep bowl. Mix 1 tbsp lemon juice and packed brown sugar, 1/4 cup each dry sherry. Pour over apples. Let stand for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally. Drain. Roll cut sides of apple wedges in flour. Melt 1/4 cup butter in medium skillet. Add apple. Cook slowly, adding more butter as needed, until browned on both sides and tender.

assumptions: apple cider or apple juice: used default unit

recipes.title: Pork Barbecue Sandwiches

instructions.text: To prepare barbecue sauce, in a heavy saucepan, heat butter. Add onion and garlic, sauté, stirring constantly, 3 to 4 minutes until onion is soft.
Add remaining ingredients. Heat to boiling. Simmer 5 minutes.
Stir sliced pork into hot sauce. Cook over low heat until meat is hot.
Spoon pork with sauce into hamburger buns.
Garnish plate with dill pickles and coleslaw. Serve immediately.

notes: Recipe may be halved or doubled. Health Note: For healthier portions, trim fat from pork prior to adding to sauce. To lower sodium, use light soy sauce.

recipes.title: Fennel-Glazed Pork Loin

instructions.text: With a small knife, cut several slivers along top of roast. Insert garlic slices and fennel seeds into slivers.
Place roast on a rack in roasting pan. Roast at 450°F for 30 minutes.
Drizzle with 2-3 tablespoons honey. Reduce heat to 350°F. Roast 30 minutes longer.
Drizzle with another 2 tablespoons honey. Sprinkle with crushed fennel. Pour in stock and wine. Reduce heat to 325°F. Continue roasting 1 hour longer or until meat reaches 160°-170°F.
Place meat on a platter. Let sit before carving.
Skim fat from pan liquid. Reheat if necessary. Serve alongside meat.

notes: Small new potatoes can be parboiled and added to roasting pan for the last hour. Turn and coat with sauce so they turn a rich color. Sprinkle with extra crushed fennel and black pepper.

recipes.title: Shrimp Newburg in Patty Shells
recipes.description: Elegant shrimp in a creamy sauce served in puff pastry shells.

instructions.text: Bake frozen patty shells according to package directions.
In a medium saucepan, melt butter. Over medium heat, blend in flour. Add seasonings.
Cook, stirring, about 3 minutes.
In a small bowl, combine egg yolks and ketchup, stirring in milk.
Add 2 to 3 teaspoons of the heated sauce. Add to teaspoon at a time stirring over low heat until thickened.

In a large skillet, heat butter over medium-high heat. Cook fillets about 2 minutes per side.
Place fillets in an ovenproof dish. Pour sauce over fish. Bake at 325°F for 10 to 15 minutes.

assumptions: fresh red snapper fillets: used default unit

recipes.title: Salt Cod Fish (Multiple Preparations)
recipes.description: Collection of traditional salt cod preparations including basic, soufflé, creamed, fish cakes, and with cheese.

instructions.text: SALT COD FISH: To freshen salt cod fish, put on in cold water and slowly bring to the boil. Keep over fish and brown in oven.
CODFISH SOUFFLE: Mix with one cup mashed potatoes and season with pepper. Add one egg well beaten. Good. (Cooked codfish) Beat until light and fluffy.
CREAMED SALT CODFISH: Freshen a pound of salt codfish, then let it simmer for about three minutes. Pour in buttered dish. Let stand in oven till set.
SALT COD FISH CAKES: Salt cod fish and potatoes feel over should be minced fine, add one well boiled egg. Pour in seasoning to taste. Add an egg mix well, put into cakes and fry in butter.

CODFISH & CHEESE: Freshen a pound of salt codfish, then let it simmer until tender. Add seasoning of pepper. In a white sauce mix with pepper. Add a luncheon dish. Can be served on toast or a luncheon dish.

notes: Traditional New England salt cod preparations

recipes.title: Turkey Burgers Deluxe
recipes.description: Flavorful turkey burgers with tarragon, served with cucumber mayo topping.
