Hellmann's or Best Foods Real or Low Fat Mayonnaise Dressing

instructions.text: Combine turkey, bread crumbs, carrots and onion; shape into four 3/4-inch thick patties.
Before lighting onion, spray rack with cooking spray on each side; spray rack with cooking spray. Broil burgers 6 minutes on each side until thoroughly cooked.
In small bowl combine mayonnaise, yogurt, tarragon, garlic salt and pepper.
Arrange lettuce, tomato and burger on bottom half of muffin halves. Top with about half the cucumber mixture. Stir in cucumber.
Arrange remaining mayonnaise, burgers, and muffin tops.

assumptions: chopped green onions: used default unit
Hellmann's or Best Foods Real or Low Fat Mayonnaise Dressing: used default unit

recipes.title: Linguine with Garden Clam Sauce
recipes.description: Quick pasta dish with clams and fresh vegetables.

ingredients.item: Mazola Right Blend Canola & Corn Oil

instructions.text: In large skillet heat oil over medium-high heat. Add zucchini and garlic; stirring frequently, cook 2 minutes. Add tomato and oregano; cook, stirring, 2 minutes longer.
Combine clam broth with enough water to make 1 3/4 cups. Stir in corn starch; add to skillet with bouillon cubes and clams. Stirring constantly, bring to boil over medium heat; boil 1 minute.
Toss with linguine and Parmesan.

assumptions: Argo or Kingsford's Corn Starch: used default unit
grated Parmesan cheese: used default unit

recipes.title: Beef Meatballs in Tomato Sauce
recipes.description: Classic homemade meatballs with rice, simmered in tomato sauce with beef broth.

instructions.text: Mix ground beef with rice, onion, thyme, egg, salt & pepper and 1/2 cup of tomato juice. Shape by heaping tablespoon into balls.
Brown in oil in frying pan. Pour off excess oil.
Combine remaining tomato juice & beef broth in same pan. Put in meat balls. Bring to boil.
Lower heat, simmer for 1 hour.

assumptions: instant beef broth: used default unit

recipes.title: Pork Chop Casserole
recipes.description: A simple one-dish pork chop bake with potatoes and noodles.

instructions.text: Brown pork chops in skillet for about 15 minutes total, turning once.
Meanwhile, cook egg noodles in 1 cup hot water until almost tender; drain.
Layer sliced potatoes and noodles in casserole dish.
Dissolve bouillon cube in 1 cup milk or water. Pour over potatoes and noodles.
Place browned pork chops on top.
Bake at 350°F for 45-60 minutes until potatoes are tender and chops are cooked through.

notes: Handwritten card is difficult to read - some ingredients/steps may need verification

recipes.title: Chef's Hamburgers
recipes.description: Elegant hamburger patties with cognac, mushrooms, and Dijon mustard sauce.

instructions.text: In a bowl, combine beef, parsley and garlic. Divide into 4 parts. Shape each into a 1-inch thick patty. Press black pepper onto both sides of each patty.
In a heavy skillet, sprinkle salt. Place over medium-high heat until smoking hot.
Add patties to skillet. Cook 1 minute on each side. Turn heat to low. Cook 2-4 minutes longer until done to your liking.
If using cognac, spoon over meat. Touch with match to flame. Remove meat from pan. Keep warm. Turn heat to high.
To the pan, add butter, mushrooms and mustard. Sauté 1 minute or until mushrooms are heated through.
Spoon over the meat patties. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve immediately.

notes: For best results, use a hot cast-iron skillet to cook hamburgers.
Hamburgers may be mixed and shaped ahead of time. Cover and refrigerate until about 1 hour before cooking.
Bring meat to room temperature prior to cooking.

recipes.title: Beef, Bean and Noodle Skillet
recipes.description: A hearty one-skillet meal with ground beef, kidney beans, and noodles.

instructions.text: In a 10-inch skillet with cover, saute beef for about 5 minutes, stirring until meat loses its red color.
Add onion, green pepper and celery. Saute 5 minutes longer. Sprinkle with salt, pepper, Worcestershire sauce and basil.
Stir in noodles, tomatoes, kidney beans and water. Add bouillon cube.
Bring mixture to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover. Simmer, stirring occasionally, for 20 minutes or until liquid is absorbed.

notes: Health Note: To reduce sodium, substitute low-salt beef broth for bouillon cube and water.
Good served with a tossed green salad or coleslaw.
Recipe may be halved or doubled.
For 8 servings, use 1 16-oz. can stewed tomatoes.

assumptions: red kidney beans: used default unit
beef bouillon cube: used default unit

recipes.title: Savory Beef
recipes.description: Tender beef cubes braised with mushrooms in a savory sauce.

instructions.text: In a large saucepan, heat oil. Add beef. Brown. Add onion and garlic. Cook, stirring, until onions are transparent.
Add flour, stirring until beef cubes are coated. Add mushrooms with juice and celery.
In a small bowl, combine remaining ingredients. Mix well. Pour over meat.
Remove from heat. Turn mixture into a greased 2-quart casserole dish.
Cover. Bake at 325°F for 1¼ to 1½ hours until meat is tender.
Sprinkle with chopped celery and chives and garnish.

notes: Recipe may be doubled. Cooking time will remain the same.
Good served with hot white rice and crusty rolls.

recipes.title: Italian Meat Loaf
recipes.description: A rolled meat loaf filled with salami and mozzarella cheese, Italian-style.

instructions.text: In a bowl, combine egg, tomato sauce, bread crumbs, parsley, oregano, garlic, salt and pepper. Add ground beef. Mix well.
Place meat on foil. Shape into a 7-by-9-inch rectangle.
Evenly sprinkle salami over top. Sprinkle cheese over salami, leaving a narrow margin around edges.
Beginning from 7-inch end, roll meat jelly-roll fashion, using foil to help you roll. Press to seal edges.
Place loaf seam-side down in a greased baking pan.
Bake at 350°F for 1 hour or until done.
Drain fat. Slice. Serve immediately.

notes: Health Note: To reduce fat, cholesterol and calories, use extra-lean ground beef or ground turkey. Eliminate the egg yolk.
Good served with hot rice or noodles and French-cut green beans sautéed in olive oil and garlic.

assumptions: tomato sauce or tomato puree: used default unit
soft bread crumbs: used default unit

recipes.title: Thai Chicken with Peanut Sauce

ingredients.prep_note: was "2 cup" - likely OCR error, corrected

instructions.text: Dry chicken with paper towel. Heat oil (or spray) in large skillet over medium heat. Cook chicken 3-4 minutes on each side, or until juices run clear.
In blender, thoroughly combine peanut butter, lime juice, water, soy sauce, honey, onion, garlic and pepper.
Spoon peanut sauce over each cooked chicken breast.

notes: Peanut sauce recipe makes 3/4 cup.

flags: Peanut butter amount corrected: 2 cups -> 1/4 cup (original likely OCR error)

assumptions: oil or cooking spray: used default unit
lime juice (or lemon): used default unit

recipes.title: Seafood Lasagna

instructions.text: Thaw seafood if frozen. Cook lasagna noodles according to package directions. Line bottom of a well-greased 2-quart oblong baking dish with 1/3 of noodles.
Carefully place sea trout over noodles, cover with 1/3 of sauce and half of ricotta cheese.
Add another layer of lasagna noodles. Place shrimp over noodles and spread an additional 1/3 of sauce. Top with remaining ricotta cheese.
Add another layer of noodles. Spread remaining sauce over noodles. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.
Bake at 400°F for 10 to 15 minutes or until heated thoroughly. Makes 8 servings.

notes: Red Snapper fillets may be substituted for sea trout.

assumptions: Florida sea trout fillets: used default unit
low fat ricotta cheese: used default unit
grated Parmesan cheese: used default unit
cooked medium shrimp: used default unit

instructions.text: Mix meat and barbecue sauce. Shape into four patties.
Place patties on grill over medium coals. Grill seven to nine minutes on each side or until cooked through (160°F), turning and brushing occasionally with additional barbecue sauce.
Top each patty with two Singles. Continue grilling until Singles are melted.
Fill rolls with lettuce, cheeseburgers and bacon.

assumptions: OSCAR MAYER Bacon: used default unit

instructions.text: Preheat grill (or skillet). Place chicken between two pieces of plastic wrap and lightly pound to flatten to same thickness throughout for even cooking.
Brush oil over both sides of chicken; grill each side until juices run clear and not pink, about 10 minutes.
Place one slice cheese over each chicken breast; cook until cheese softens.
Heat remaining oil in medium skillet over medium heat. Cook onions, stirring, until softened. Stir in tomatoes, cilantro, salt and pepper; cook an additional minute.
Place chicken on serving plate; spoon tomato mixture over chicken and cheese. Serve with rice.

assumptions: PUBLIX Boneless, Skinless Chicken Breasts: used default unit
Jalapeño Monterey Jack cheese: used default unit
chopped cilantro, salt and pepper: used default unit

recipes.title: Chicken and Portobello Mushrooms in Tarragon Cream Sauce

instructions.text: Heat oil and 1 tablespoon butter in large skillet over medium-high heat.
Season chicken with salt and pepper. Cook chicken until golden brown on both sides and cooked through, about 5-6 minutes per side. Remove and keep warm.
Add mushrooms to skillet and cook until softened. Add onion and cook until translucent.
Add broth and cream; bring to a simmer. Add tarragon and cook until sauce thickens slightly.
Return chicken to skillet and spoon sauce over. Serve immediately.

assumptions: finely minced onion: used default unit
sliced Baby Portobello Mushrooms: used default unit

instructions.text: Using 8 wooden or metal skewers, thread 8 ham chunks, 4 pineapple chunks and red and green pepper pieces on each.
Place in a single layer on shallow baking pan. In small bowl, mix together cranberry sauce, cloves, mustard and vinegar. Pour mixture over kabobs.
Bake in 400°F oven 15-20 minutes, basting often. Serve immediately.

assumptions: PUBLIX jellied cranberry sauce: used default unit
juice-packed pineapple chunks: used default unit

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F. Line baking sheet with foil and spray with cooking spray.
In shallow bowl, whisk together egg and milk. In another bowl, combine coconut and curry powder.
Dip chicken tenders in egg mixture, then coat with coconut mixture. Place on prepared baking sheet.
Bake 15-20 minutes or until chicken is cooked through and coconut is golden.
Meanwhile, mix honey and Dijon mustard for dipping sauce. Serve chicken with sauce.

assumptions: PUBLIX Premium chicken breast tenders: used default unit

recipes.title: Homemade Macaroni & Cheese with Buttered Breadcrumbs and Crisp Bacon

instructions.text: Cook macaroni according to package directions, drain and return to cooking pot.
In medium saucepan over medium heat, melt butter. Stir in flour; cook 1 minute until smooth and lightly browned. Stir in garlic.
Add broth and milk. Bring mixture to boil, stirring, until sauce has thickened, 2 minutes.
Add cheese, mustard, salt and pepper; stir until cheese melts.
Pour sauce over macaroni; stir to coat evenly. Transfer to serving bowl. Top with breadcrumbs and bacon.
*Buttered Breadcrumbs: In blender, grate white bread into crumbs. In skillet over medium heat, melt 1-1/2 Tbsp. butter. Add crumbs; stir until lightly browned and crisp.
*Cut bacon crosswise into 1/4-inch strips. In skillet over medium heat, cook until drippings are rendered and bacon is crisp, 7 minutes. Drain on paper towel.

assumptions: PUBLIX Elbow Macaroni: used default unit
PUBLIX Sweet Cream Butter: used default unit
PUBLIX Shredded Sharp Cheddar Cheese: used default unit

Cook rice according to package directions, using reserved broth instead of water.
Chop cooked giblets and add to rice.
Stuff hens with rice mixture. Truss with skewers and butcher's twine.
Heat butter, wine, and rosemary in a small pan until butter is melted.
Arrange hens in shallow roasting pan. Baste with butter mixture.
Roast at 425°F for 1 hour or until done, basting with butter mixture several times.
Chill until it's time for the picnic.

Place steak in a shallow dish and pour marinade over it.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.
Grill or broil steak to desired doneness.

assumptions: fresh ginger, grated: used default unit

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F or prepare grill for indirect cooking.
Season ribs with salt and pepper. Place in roasting pan.
Bake for 1-1/2 hours, then brush with barbecue sauce.
Continue cooking for 30 minutes, basting occasionally.
Serve with buttered corn on the cob.

Mix brown sugar, ketchup, vinegar, Worcestershire, and red pepper flakes.
Add onion and garlic to pot. Pour sauce mixture over roast.

Form into meatballs about 1-1/2 inches in diameter.

Make white sauce with butter, flour, and milk.
Add cod and egg yolks; mix well.
Beat egg whites until stiff; fold into mixture.
Pour into greased baking dish; bake at 375°F for 30-35 minutes.

Layer cod and sauce in baking dish. Top with breadcrumbs.

Form into 1-1/2 inch meatballs.
Brown meatballs in skillet; drain fat.
Add tomato sauce and Italian seasoning; simmer 20 minutes.
Serve over pasta or with crusty bread.

instructions.text: Make slits in lamb and insert garlic slivers.
Rub with rosemary, salt, and pepper.
Roast at 325°F for about 20 minutes per pound for medium.
For mint sauce: combine mint, vinegar, and sugar. Let stand 30 minutes.
Serve sliced lamb with mint sauce on the side.

fresh mint, chopped: used default unit

recipes.title: Corned Beef Hash Casserole

instructions.text: In a small skillet, melt butter. Add green pepper and onion. Cook until limp but not brown.
In a small bowl, combine sour cream, mustard, cayenne and black pepper. Mix well.
In a medium bowl, combine hash and onion and green pepper. Add sour cream mixture. Blend thoroughly.
Transfer mixture to large shallow casserole. Add salt, if desired.
Arrange egg slices on top. Sprinkle with parsley. Bake at 400°F until bubbly and lightly browned, about 25 minutes.

notes: Tips: Poached eggs may be used instead of hard-boiled.

recipes.title: Deviled Cornish Hens

Rub hens inside and outside with salt, pepper, and garlic.
Place hens side-by-side in roasting pan.
To prepare basting sauce, mix together all sauce ingredients.
Brush hens with sauce.
Roast hens at 375°F for about 50 minutes, basting occasionally with sauce and pan juices. Check doneness by pricking thigh joint with a toothpick. When juices run clear, the hens are ready.
Garnish with watercress, if used.

notes: Good served with: Brown or wild rice, a tossed green salad and crusty French bread.

recipes.title: Quick Corn Soufflé
recipes.description: An easy corn soufflé that puffs up golden brown.

instructions.text: In stainless steel bowl, beat eggs lightly. Stir in corn, salt, pepper, butter, flour, sugar and milk. Beat until well mixed.
Add baking powder. Mix well.
Spoon into buttered 1-cup soufflé dishes. Place on cookie sheet.
Bake at 425°F for 20 minutes or until puffed and golden brown.
Garnish with pepper slices, if used. Serve immediately.

notes: Health Note: To reduce sodium, use no-salt-added canned creamed corn. Good served with ham steaks and rye bread.

recipes.title: Broccoli Casserole
recipes.description: A cheesy broccoli casserole side dish.

instructions.text: Cook and drain broccoli according to package directions.
Mix broccoli with mayonnaise (or cream cheese), eggs, margarine, onion, salt and pepper.
Pour into greased 9x13 casserole dish.
Top with crushed Ritz crackers.
Bake at 400°F for 15-25 minutes or until golden.

notes: Option: Add hot peppers for heat.

recipes.title: Broccoli with Egg Dressing
recipes.description: Fresh broccoli topped with a creamy egg dressing.

instructions.text: Steam broccoli until tender-crisp. Drain and keep warm.
Mix mayonnaise, lemon juice, and mustard.
Fold in chopped eggs.
Season with salt and pepper.
Spoon dressing over warm broccoli and serve.

recipes.title: Pickled Beets
recipes.description: Simple homemade pickled beets.

instructions.text: Drop beets in boiling salted water, cook until tender (if using fresh beets).
Boil sugar, water, vinegar, and allspice together for 5 minutes.
Slice beets and add to pickling solution.
Refrigerate. Serve cold.

recipes.title: Easy Potato Gratin

ingredients.item: fresh parsley, minced fresh chives and dried chervil leaves

instructions.text: In saucepan, heat oil and 1 tablespoon butter. Add onion. Sauté over low heat until limp but not brown, about 5 minutes.
Add ham and garlic. Cook 2 minutes.
In a bowl, combine eggs, herbs, cheese, cream, pepper and salt. Beat well.
Rinse shredded potatoes in cold water. Drain well. Add potatoes to egg mixture. Stir in ham mixture. Blend well.
Spread mixture into a buttered 9- or 10-inch round, shallow baking dish. Dot with remaining butter.
Bake at 375°F for 30 to 40 minutes until top is browned. Serve immediately.

notes: Recipe may be halved or doubled. For 2 servings, use an 8-inch round baking dish. For 8, use 2 10-inch round dishes.

recipes.title: Toasted Herb Rice
recipes.description: Flavorful oven-baked rice with herbs and soy sauce.

instructions.text: In an ovenproof casserole with lid, place rice. Roast at 325°F for 20 minutes or until rice is toasted and golden.
Remove from oven.
Add butter. Stir until melted. Pour boiling broth and water over rice. Stir.
Cover. Return to oven. Bake 30 minutes or until rice is cooked through and has absorbed all liquid.
Stir in onions, soy sauce and tarragon. Serve immediately.

notes: Recipe may be halved or doubled
Good served with baked or roasted chicken, turkey or lamb, broccoli with Hollandaise sauce or tomato salad with Italian-style dressing

recipes.title: Spanish Rice
recipes.description: Classic Spanish rice with tomato sauce and herbs.

instructions.text: In an ovenproof saucepan, heat oil.
Add onion. Cook over medium-high heat until onion is amber, not brown, about 3 minutes.
Stir in rice. Cook until rice changes color, about 5 minutes.
Add peppers and the tomatoes. Cook about 5 minutes.
Add water, tomato sauce, garlic, bay leaf, oregano, salt and pepper. Bring to boil. Cover. Bake at 425°F for 20 minutes.
Remove bay leaf and garlic clove before serving. Serve immediately.

notes: Be sure to remove bay leaf and garlic cloves from this dish before serving
Good served with Mexican chimichangas or burritos and refried beans

recipes.title: Caramel Corn
recipes.description: Homemade caramel corn - crunchy and sweet.

instructions.text: Pop corn and place in large roasting pan. Add nuts if using.
In saucepan, combine butter, brown sugar, corn syrup, water, and cream of tartar.
Bring to boil, stirring constantly. Boil 5 minutes.
Remove from heat. Stir in baking soda (mixture will foam).
Pour over popcorn, stirring to coat evenly.
Bake at 250°F, stirring every 15 minutes, for about 1 hour.
Spread on wax paper to cool. Break apart when cooled.

notes: Store in airtight container. Like brittle when done right.

recipes.title: Crabmeat Clam Chowder

instructions.text: In a heavy saucepan, melt butter. Add garlic, if used. Sauté 30 seconds. Add onions and potatoes. Sauté 2 minutes or until onions are heated through.
Add water. Simmer 15 minutes or until potatoes are cooked. Stir in milk, salt and pepper. Bring to a boil.
Combine flour with 4 tablespoons water. Mix to make a smooth paste. Stir into boiling mixture. Cook about 4 minutes until thickened.
Stir in crab and clams in juice. Heat through.
Ladle into serving bowls. Top each with a dollop of whipped cream. Sprinkle with parsley.

notes: Good served with: A tossed salad, warm rolls and a light, dry white wine, if desired.

assumptions: sliced green onions: used default unit

recipes.title: Beef Vegetable Soup

instructions.text: Cut beef into small 1/2-inch wide strips. In a heavy 3-quart saucepan, heat oil. Add meat. Lightly brown onion. Sauté 3-4 minutes.
Add salt, pepper, barley, if used, parsley, broth, water and tomatoes. Bring to a boil.
Cover. Simmer for 30 minutes.
To prepare croutons, toss bread cubes with butter. Sprinkle with Edam, stirring after 5 minutes.
Ladle soup into bowls. Top with croutons.

notes: Tips: For added flavor, other vegetables such as potatoes, green beans, peas, celery or parsnips may be added to soup.

Cheese Croutons: 1 cup fresh bread cubes, 1 Tbsp butter or margarine, ¼ cup shredded Edam cheese. Melt butter in skillet. Add bread cubes. Cook 15 to 20 minutes until golden, stirring occasionally. Sprinkle with cheese.

recipes.title: Lime Coconut in Pineapple
recipes.description: A refreshing lime gelatin salad with pineapple and coconut.

Add pineapple juice. Chill until partially set.
Fold in drained pineapple and coconut.
Add remaining ingredients and mix well.
Pour into mold or dish.
Refrigerate until firm.

recipes.title: Vegetable Mix Salad

instructions.text: In a bowl, combine canned vegetables, potato, celery and onion. Toss lightly.
To prepare dressing, in separate bowl, combine mayonnaise, lemon juice, salt and pepper. Mix well.
Add dressing to vegetables. Toss gently. Cover. Chill for at least 1 hour.
On a serving platter or in a bowl, mound salad. Surround with beets. Garnish with parsley.

notes: Recipe may be doubled. Tips: To make this dish into a satisfying brunch, add a small can of drained shrimp to salad.
Good served with: Roast lamb, rice pilaf, glazed carrots, and brownies for dessert.

recipes.title: Garden Leaf Salad

instructions.text: To prepare dressing, in a small bowl, whisk together all ingredients. Blend well. Cover bowl with plastic wrap. Chill.
Gently tear lettuce. Place in a large serving bowl. Add radishes and eggs.

notes: For best flavor, serve this salad slightly chilled. Any member of the Butterhead lettuce family is fine for this recipe. Varieties include Bibb, Boston and Buttercrunch. Recipe may be halved or doubled.
